title: Video Utilization Strategies for Blended Teacher Education: Applying the Laboratory Rotation Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education theories and practical experience
context.additional_context: Corporate In-Service Math Teacher Re-Education Program Offering a Blended Learning Environment Combining Theory and Practice Through a Lab Rotation Model. Learners watch video content using personal devices (BYOD) and rotate between classrooms and lab spaces.

learning_goals: Learners can explain effective video utilization strategies in laboratory rotation model-based instruction.
Learners can apply methods to enhance learning motivation by integrating video into mathematics pedagogy in actual classrooms.
Learners can resolve technical issues encountered during the production and utilization of video content.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
